result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis S Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: (STRAIGHT TIME), concurrent to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 3/21/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.

No contact with co-defendants unless approved by agent.
Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: (STRAIGHT TIME), this time is stayed pending a review on 9/21/2016.

corrected ORDER For Early Discharge from Probation Pursuant to 973.9(3)(d).
THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the period of probation be modified and that the offender be discharged from probation supervision pursuant to 973.09(3)(d). The Department of Corrections will effectuate this change on the date of this order.
Signed and filed.

Order GRANTING early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09 (3)(d) signed and filed.  
"THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the period of probation be modified and that the offender be discharged from probation supervision pursuant to 97.09(3)(d). The Department of Corrections will effectuate this change on the date of this order"
Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.

forwarded to Judge Hanrahan

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Defendant is doing well on supervision. Defense counsel requests early release from probation for reasons stated on the record. Arguments heard. The Court GRANTS defense request and orders probation to be terminated at the end of the month of November.
Probation Status Review Report from agent Kevin M.; received and filed.
Probation Review Hearing on November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Clerk spoke with agent Kevin Martins and advised him that this case should be heard before Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.

Court received a call from the defendant's attorney regarding a Probation Review Hearing Scheduled for 9/21. Unfortunately the court was not aware of this date. This matter has been adjourned to 11/4/2016 at 1:30.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Hanrahan
for review. os

Bail refund check packet

Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Jessica Bellows.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for return of property hearing.  Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing on April 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
MPD Inventory #15-186-0016(DENNIS RAY).
Letters in support of Dennis Ray, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. State placed negotiations on the record.   

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 60 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          pending a review on 9/21/2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 21.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   No contact with co-defendants unless approved by agent.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   No firearms; weapons
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the
          DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 3/21/2017.
          Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined by the court as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with court.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Motion for severance filed by State.  Defense no objection.  Court grants State's motion for severance.  Defense requests another jury trial date.  Jury trial date of 3-07-2016 vacated by the Court.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion for Severance, received and filed.

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests to schedule case for final pretrial and jury trial along with co-defendants.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for a status conference case. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 07/06/2015

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dennis S Ray in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/8/15 @ 1:30pm
